Workflow.Name: Time Off Manager Approval
Workflow.Description: Run a flow from Copilot and send back a response requesting a Teams approval from the manager.

Description.description: Run a flow from Copilot and send back a response requesting a Teams approval from the manager.

Workflow.Name: Get Time Off Balance
Workflow.Description: This flow processes a request for time off by gathering an employee's ID, the type of time off, and an end date. It estimates future time off balances based on the provided information. The data is parsed to extract relevant details about the time off balance, including the type, name, units, balance, end date, policy type, and used year-to-date. The flow then filters the estimated balances to find the specific type of time off requested and responds with the corresponding balance, ensuring the information is structured and ready for further use.

Description.description: This flow processes a request for time off by gathering an employee's ID, the type of time off, and an end date. It estimates future time off balances based on the provided information. The data is parsed to extract relevant details about the time off balance, including the type, name, units, balance, end date, policy type, and used year-to-date. The flow then filters the estimated balances to find the specific type of time off requested and responds with the corresponding balance, ensuring the information is structured and ready for further use.

Workflow.Name: Get All Sprints
Workflow.Description: The flow retrieves active and future sprints from a specified board in a project management tool. It processes the response to extract relevant details such as sprint ID, name, state, start date, and end date. The extracted information is formatted and structured into a JSON object. Finally, the flow responds with the formatted sprint data, providing a comprehensive overview of the sprints, including their statuses and timelines, ensuring that the information is easily accessible and usable for further actions or insights.

Description.description: The flow retrieves active and future sprints from a specified board in a project management tool. It processes the response to extract relevant details such as sprint ID, name, state, start date, and end date. The extracted information is formatted and structured into a JSON object. Finally, the flow responds with the formatted sprint data, providing a comprehensive overview of the sprints, including their statuses and timelines, ensuring that the information is easily accessible and usable for further actions or insights.

Workflow.Name: Sprint Classification
Workflow.Description: Run a flow from Copilot and send back a response classifying the sprint into current, outside or future.

Description.description: Run a flow from Copilot and send back a response classifying the sprint into current, outside or future.

Workflow.Name: Get All Sprint Issues
Workflow.Description: This flow retrieves sprint information from a project management tool based on specified states. It gathers all sprints for a given board, parses the data, and extracts relevant sprint details. It then fetches fields related to story points and collects issues associated with each sprint. The flow calculates the total story points across all issues and compiles a list of issues with their details, including assignee and creator information. Finally, it responds with a structured output containing the project information and the total story points calculated from the issues.

Description.description: This flow retrieves sprint information from a project management tool based on specified states. It gathers all sprints for a given board, parses the data, and extracts relevant sprint details. It then fetches fields related to story points and collects issues associated with each sprint. The flow calculates the total story points across all issues and compiles a list of issues with their details, including assignee and creator information. Finally, it responds with a structured output containing the project information and the total story points calculated from the issues.

Workflow.Name: Create Time Off Request
Workflow.Description: This flow processes a time off request by gathering essential information such as employee ID, approval status, start and end dates, type of time off, total hours requested, reason for the request, and manager comments. It ensures all required fields are filled before creating the request. Upon successful creation, a confirmation message is generated. The flow integrates with an external system to submit the request, including notes from both the employee and the manager. This structured approach facilitates efficient handling of time off requests within the organization.

Description.description: This flow processes a time off request by gathering essential information such as employee ID, approval status, start and end dates, type of time off, total hours requested, reason for the request, and manager comments. It ensures all required fields are filled before creating the request. Upon successful creation, a confirmation message is generated. The flow integrates with an external system to submit the request, including notes from both the employee and the manager. This structured approach facilitates efficient handling of time off requests within the organization.

Workflow.Name: Validate Team Membership
Workflow.Description: The flow begins by requesting an email address. It retrieves employee data from an external API and parses the information. Team member details are fetched from another service, and the flow checks if the provided email matches any team member's email. If a match is found, it confirms the email belongs to a valid team member; otherwise, it indicates the email is not associated with a team member. Finally, the flow responds with a message indicating the team membership status of the provided email address.

Description.description: The flow begins by requesting an email address. It retrieves employee data from an external API and parses the information. Team member details are fetched from another service, and the flow checks if the provided email matches any team member's email. If a match is found, it confirms the email belongs to a valid team member; otherwise, it indicates the email is not associated with a team member. Finally, the flow responds with a message indicating the team membership status of the provided email address.

Workflow.Name: Get Sprint Issues
Workflow.Description: This flow retrieves sprint issues from a JIRA board based on a provided sprint ID. It first fetches the fields to identify the "Story Points" field. Then, it gathers issues associated with the specified sprint, extracting relevant details such as issue ID, key, type, priority, creator, assignee, and story points. The flow calculates the total story points across all issues and prepares a response containing the list of issues and the total story points. Finally, it sends this information back in a structured format.

Description.description: This flow retrieves sprint issues from a JIRA board based on a provided sprint ID. It first fetches the fields to identify the "Story Points" field. Then, it gathers issues associated with the specified sprint, extracting relevant details such as issue ID, key, type, priority, creator, assignee, and story points. The flow calculates the total story points across all issues and prepares a response containing the list of issues and the total story points. Finally, it sends this information back in a structured format.

Workflow.Name: Get Sprint Story Points
Workflow.Description: This flow retrieves the total story points for issues in a specified sprint. It starts by accepting a sprint ID, then fetches field details to identify the story points field. Next, it gathers issues associated with the sprint and filters out subtasks. The flow calculates the total story points by summing the values from the relevant field for each issue. Finally, it responds with the total story points in the selected sprint, providing a structured output that includes the total value. The process ensures accurate aggregation of story points for project management purposes.

Description.description: This flow retrieves the total story points for issues in a specified sprint. It starts by accepting a sprint ID, then fetches field details to identify the story points field. Next, it gathers issues associated with the sprint and filters out subtasks. The flow calculates the total story points by summing the values from the relevant field for each issue. Finally, it responds with the total story points in the selected sprint, providing a structured output that includes the total value. The process ensures accurate aggregation of story points for project management purposes.

Connector.description: REST API for Jira which is a software product developed by Atlassian that allows bug tracking, issue tracking and agile project management.
Connector.name: new_jira-20api

Connector.description: BambooHR API for the SASS BambooHR platform that brings all your employee, payroll, time, and benefit information together in one place, giving you the data accuracy, security, and coordination you need to sleep soundly.
Connector.name: crafa_5Fbamboohr-20api

AIConfiguration.msdyn_customconfiguration:
{"version":"GptDynamicPrompt-2","prompt":[{"type":"literal","text":"You will receive a JSON object "},{"type":"inputVariable","id":"sprints"},{"type":"literal","text":" containing:
A list of sprints with their name, state, start and end dates. 
A time off request with a start "},{"type":"inputVariable","id":"StartDate"},{"type":"literal","text":" and end date "},{"type":"inputVariable","id":"EndDate"},{"type":"literal","text":" .
Your task is to Classify the time-off request based on sprint data:
Identify the current sprint (where "state": "active").
Identify any future sprints (where "state": "future").
Compare the time off request dates with sprint dates and classify as:
"current sprint" if both dates fall entirely within the current sprint.
"future sprint" if either date falls in a future sprint.
"outside sprint" if neither date overlaps with any sprint.

Edge Case: If the request starts in the current sprint but extends into a future sprint, classify as "future sprint"."}],"definitions":{"inputs":[{"id":"sprints","text":"sprints","type":"text","quickTestValue":"[
 {
 "id": 1,
 "name": "Sprint 2",
 "state": "active",
 "startDate": "2025-01-29",
 "endDate": "2025-02-12"
 },
 {
 "id": 3,
 "name": "Sprint 3",
 "state": "future",
 "startDate": "2025-02-12",
 "endDate": "2025-02-26"
 }
]"},{"id":"StartDate","text":"StartDate","type":"text","quickTestValue":"2025-02-03"},{"id":"EndDate","text":"EndDate","type":"text","quickTestValue":"2025-02-04"}],"data":[],"output":{"formats":["text"],"jsonSchema":{"type":"object","properties":{"classification":{"type":"string"}}},"jsonExamples":[{"classification":"current sprint"}]}},"modelParameters":{"modelType":"gpt-35-turbo","gptParameters":{"temperature":0}},"settings":{"recordRetrievalLimit":30}}

{"version":"GptDynamicPrompt-2","prompt":[{"type":"literal","text":"You are an expert in parsing emails to extract key information related to time off requests. Your task is to read the provided "},{"type":"inputVariable","id":"text"},{"type":"literal","text":" (subject and body) of an email and extract the following fields, including their possible synonyms:

- Start Date (synonyms: start date, begin date, starting on, from, commencing on)
- End Date (synonyms: end date, finish date, ending on, until, concluding on)
- Reason (synonyms: reason, cause, purpose, explanation, rationale)
- Total Hours (synonyms: total hours, duration, length, number of hours, time period)
- Time Off Type(synonyms: time off category, category of leave, type of leave, kind of leave, nature of leave, form of leave)

If any of these fields are not present or cannot be extracted from the text, list them as missing fields otherwise specify a message that all expected fields are present on the email.
If the "},{"type":"inputVariable","id":"timeOffType"},{"type":"literal","text":" parameter is provided with a value take that value."}],"definitions":{"inputs":[{"id":"text","text":"text","type":"text","quickTestValue":"Subject: Leave
Body: Dear HR, I need to take some time off due to the passing of my grandfather. I would like to request leave from June 1st to June 5th.Would total 12 hours."},{"id":"timeOffType","text":"timeOffType","type":"text","quickTestValue":"sss"}],"data":[],"output":{"formats":["text"],"jsonSchema":{"type":"object","properties":{"Start Date":{"type":"string"},"End Date":{"type":"string"},"Reason":{"type":"string"},"Total Hours":{"type":"string"},"Time Off Type":{"type":"string"},"Missing Fields":{"type":"array"}}},"jsonExamples":[{"Start Date":"June 1st","End Date":"June 5th","Reason":"due to the passing of my grandfather","Total Hours":"12 hours","Time Off Type":"sss","Missing Fields":[]}]}},"modelParameters":{"modelType":"gpt-35-turbo","gptParameters":{"temperature":0}},"settings":{"recordRetrievalLimit":30}}

{"version":"GptDynamicPrompt-2","prompt":[{"type":"literal","text":"You are an expert in analyzing emails to determine if they contain a time off request. Your task is to read the subject and body of the provided email and decide whether it is a time off request. If it is, identify the specific category of time off from the following list: "},{"type":"inputVariable","id":"categories"},{"type":"literal","text":" 
If the email with this text "},{"type":"inputVariable","id":"mail"},{"type":"literal","text":" does not contain a time off request, return this text "No time off request was detected"."}],"definitions":{"inputs":[{"id":"mail","text":"mail","type":"text","quickTestValue":"Dear Isabel,

I hope this message finds you well. I would like to request time off as per the details below:

Start Date: February 3, 2025

End Date: February 4, 2025

Reason: Uncle died

Type of Time Off: Bereavement

Total Hours: 1 hour

Please let me know if you need any additional information or if there's a need for further discussion.

Best regards,

Anthony Zimmerman"},{"id":"categories","text":"categories","type":"text","quickTestValue":"Vacation, Sick, COVID-19 Related Absence, Bereavement, Comp/In Lieu Time, FMLA."}],"data":[],"output":{"formats":["json"],"jsonSchema":{"type":"object","properties":{"time_off_request":{"type":"boolean"},"category":{"type":"string"}}},"jsonExamples":[{"time_off_request":true,"category":"Bereavement"}]}},"modelParameters":{"modelType":"gpt-35-turbo","gptParameters":{"temperature":0}},"settings":{"recordRetrievalLimit":30}}

{"version":"GptDynamicPrompt-2","prompt":[{"type":"literal","text":"You are an expert in analyzing emails to determine if they contain a time off request. Your task is to read the subject and body of the provided email and decide whether it is a time off request. If it is, identify the specific category of time off from the following list: "},{"type":"inputVariable","id":"categories"},{"type":"literal","text":" .
If the email with this text "},{"type":"inputVariable","id":"mail"},{"type":"literal","text":" does not contain a time off request, simply state that no time off request was detected."}],"definitions":{"inputs":[{"id":"categories","text":"categories","type":"text","quickTestValue":"Vacation, Sick, COVID-19 Related Absence, Bereavement, Comp/In Lieu Time, FMLA."},{"id":"mail","text":"mail","type":"text","quickTestValue":"Example 1:
Subject: Vacation Request
Body: Hi, I would like to take a vacation from December 20th to January 5th. Please approve my leave.

Example 2:
Subject: Sick Leave
Body: Hello, I am feeling unwell today and will need to take a sick day. I expect to be back tomorrow.

Example 3:
Subject: Meeting Reminder
Body: Don't forget about the team meeting at 3 PM today.

Example 4:
Subject: Bereavement Leave
Body: Dear HR, I need to take some time off due to the passing of my grandfather. I would like to request bereavement leave from June 1st to June 5th.

Example 5:
Subject: Comp Time Request
Body: Hi Manager, I worked extra hours last week and would like to take comp time this Friday. Please let me know if that's okay.

Example 6:
Subject: FMLA Leave
Body: Hello, I need to take an extended leave under FMLA as my spouse is undergoing surgery. I plan to be out from July 1st to August 1st.

Example 7:
Subject: Sick Day
Body: Hi, I'm not feeling well today and will be taking a sick day. Please inform my team.

Example 8:
Subject: Vacation Days
Body: Good morning, I would like to request vacation days from October 10th to October 15th. Looking forward to your approval.

Example 9:
Subject: Personal Emergency
Body: Hi, I have a personal emergency and need to take the rest of the week off. I hope to return on Monday.

Example 10:
Subject: COVID-19 Absence
Body: Hello, I have tested positive for COVID-19 and need to take time off until I recover. I expect to be back by next week."}],"data":[],"output":{"formats":["text"],"jsonSchema":{"type":"object","properties":{"time_off_request_detected":{"type":"boolean"},"category":{"type":"string"}}},"jsonExamples":[{"time_off_request_detected":true,"category":"Vacation"}]}},"modelParameters":{"modelType":"gpt-35-turbo","gptParameters":{"temperature":0}},"settings":{"recordRetrievalLimit":30,"shouldPreserveRecordLinks":null}}
